title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat. Add diced pancetta and cook until crispy, about 8-10 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Add drained spaghetti to the pan with pancetta (heat turned off). Toss to combine.
Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta, tossing continuously to create a creamy sauce. Add pasta water as needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, 1 tsp garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Let sit for 2 hours or overnight.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through and charred in spots. Set aside.
Heat oil in a large pan. Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the mixture.
Add cream, remaining garam masala, and kasuri methi. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add grilled chicken and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Colorful vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce, ready in under 15 minutes.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, carrots, broccoli, snap peas)
1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Cut all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli) and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Mix in soy sauce and oyster sauce.
Add cornstarch slurry and cook until sauce thickens.
Drizzle with sesame oil and toss to combine.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
